page.title: 01River Severn At Welsh Border
page.content: This area contains mainly farming communities and is dominated by the River Severn where it crosses the Welsh Border to the west of Shrewsbury. The farming is predominantly dairy, cattle or sheep raised on the grasslands along both banks of the River Severn. This land is liable to flooding after heavy rainfall which precludes the planting of seed, but is good for grass during periods of drought as the land never completely dries out. The River Vyrnwy joins the River Severn in the SW corner of the area. Away from the rivers, some land is arable and the main crops grown are; wheat, barley, sugar beet and potatoes. Many farms are owner-farmed but a large proportion are farmed by tennant farmers. The village of Crew Green in the SW corner of the ara has the
